Class IRElection

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRElection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Election

    public class IRElection
extends java.lang.Object
implements Election

    IRElection

    Purpose

    The IRElection class provides methods to obtain the results of an IR election specified by some BallotFile.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IRElection(BallotFile bf)
      Initializes an IRElection with the proper IR election parameters specified in bf.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IRElection

        public IRElection(BallotFile bf)
        Initializes an IRElection with the proper IR election parameters specified in bf.
        Parameters:
        bf - A BallotFile object representing the ballot file to be considered.

    • Method Detail

      • getCandidateWinners

        public java.util.Set<Candidate> getCandidateWinners()
        Method to obtain the winning candidate of an IRElection instance. A candidate is determined to be a winner if it has won a majority of the votes in the election or been determined to be a winner by a "coin toss" in a scenario where there's a tie between two candidates
        Specified by:
        getCandidateWinners in interface Election
        Returns:
        A Set containing all Candidate objects that have been determined to be winners.

      • getPartyWinners

        public java.util.Set<Party> getPartyWinners()
        Method to obtain the party of the winning candidate of an IRElection instance.
        Specified by:
        getPartyWinners in interface Election
        Returns:
        A Set containing all Party objects that have been determined to be winners.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to obtain the results of an IRElection instance.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing a short description of the election parameters as well as the winner.

      • getQuota

        public int getQuota()
        Method to obtain the quota for an IRElection instance. The quota denotes the number of ballots any candidate must obtain in order to win the election.
        Returns:
        An int denoting the quota for the election.
